instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a shorted <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and flashing led on logic board
threads.message:
Hello,

By removing the <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> chip, short goes away. Installed another chip from a donor board same thing. Anyone run across this before? This is the only chip that immediately gets hot under infrared camera, rest of the board does not heat up when I force voltage on the <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>.

The only other Item I did find for sure bad was <CAPACITOR>C7806</CAPACITOR>. It was shorted to ground replaced it, still have direct short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>.

Any help would be appreciated. 

Thanks

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a shorted <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and flashing led on logic board
threads.message:
Which is the exact ohm value of the short?
Also check diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a shorted <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and flashing led on logic board
threads.message:
Update for reference. 

Installed another <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> chip short now gone. Still only 5v at the charge port. LED light stays on solid now also. Darn, thought that was it, but no.

My methods of checking voltages in order they are on the diagrams is bad for me. I should have checked core voltages and shorts on the core lines first and I would not have wasted so much time on this board.

<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 0v----- diode mode .2----- ohm check at <CAPACITOR>C1131</CAPACITOR> .2 ohms----- dead short, great :(

So injected 2amps voltage @1.5v at <CAPACITOR>C1131</CAPACITOR> and the only thing that reacted under infrared was the intel chip. Removed chip, short gone!!! Bad intel chip. So if I would have jumped over to the core voltage checks first and found bad intel chip, obviously would at that point put this board in the parts bind and moved on and not bothered you guys on this one. Sorry, my bad. I try to only to ask questions that I'm really having difficulty with. So I hope this will at the least help someone else in the future.

Thanks for your time.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a shorted <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and flashing led on logic board
threads.message:
0.2 ohm is really short.
Not clear if is what you meant.
2 ohm could be normal value.

threads.title: 2019 Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a shorted <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and flashing led on logic board
threads.message:
Yes, double checked and it was .2 ohms on that line. Short went away after removing the intel chip.

Thanks
